text: I've said it before, and I'll say it again. The music in this game is so unbelievably convincing! If I hadn't know any better, I would have thought this was actual NES music! Does anybody know if the soundtrack in this game is bending the rules of the NES sound chip at all?

author: Arjun Singh Lotay

text: Every time I boot up this game, I say the title in my head in the most hotblooded way possible as if when I press start the announcer is going to call out the title.  Dunno why I do that.
author: ParrotMan01

text: I just completed this game yesterday. I have to say, it's not very good in my book. While it is mostly polished (experienced a bug where it would shoot backwards if I change direction and use jetpack at the same time), there was very little variety, not that many levels, and 0 replayability. Also I didn't think it was very hard; some parts were frustrating, where you might fail like 20 times - but it always feels like the game's fault and not yours. You have to play like a robot.
author: NeatNit

text: I managed to catch this game for sale on iOS. Very fun, and it actually doesn't have a horrible virtual keypad, like some games tend to. Though I imagine that playing with actual buttons on pc/3ds would still be better.

text: This is pretty good for sure, but it's not my favorite track in the game. I think It's tied for me between V-Land, G-Land, and World 2-2.

Fun game. At no point in the game did I feel like the game was being too cheap. If you die, it's your fault. And the Granny DLC levels was a nice touch.

I look forward to the eventual sequel ;D

text: Very hard game, I have it on my 3DS but I've yet to finish it. The chiptune soundtrack is super good though, it really has that oldschool feel. This theme is just plain groovy, great energy. Mutant Mudds Deluxe will be released later this year on the Wii U.
